oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Secession Cockade
Hair Ornament Worn by Female Confederate Sympathizers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is red velvet made into a looped bow and attached to a card that reads, "Secession cockade, made by my mother and worn by me."
This red bow was worn by a Polk family cousin during the Civil War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865; Emblems
Capturing the Flag
Women
